A ‚Äúpolycrisis‚Äù world is where crises are complex and interwoven. It is no longer sufficient for leaders to deal with each crisis in isolation. It demands a holistic sense-making of the complex web of challenges and the ability to formulate comprehensive strategies that address the underlying issues. Soft skills are thus required to rally teams, and for national crises, the population at large. All this requires leaders to transcend traditional boundaries and embrace interdisciplinary thinking. Equipping leaders with the necessary skills becomes all the more important. Since its inception in 2006, the Home Team Academy has been doing that for the Home Team leaders. Today, the Home Team has gone beyond serving Home Team departments to providing the whole public service with crisis leadership training. For this special issue, besides working on the required skills and competencies for leaders, we have also incorporated important works done by our Home Team psychologists to strengthen the leadership development. We are also very privileged to have contributions from scholars, practitioners, and thought leaders in homefront security, as well as our strategic partners in training. Dive into our carefully curated issue on crisis leadership and allow it to enlighten, inspire and guide you through these complex times. Enjoy your reading! Majeed Khader Alan Bersin John Latham Mike Hardy Dr Amanda Davies Phd Dr Victoria Herrington Stuart Bartels APM Juliette Kayyem Jansen Ang John Cuddihy #hta #mha #htpd #FLETC #leardership #leadershipdevelopment #crisismanagement #crisisleadership #partnership #collaboration

Issue 13 of the Home Team Journal is out! The Journal is a publication by the Home Team Academy that features expert insights into the issues, policies, and operations of the Home Team and its partners. Read the latest issue, a Special Issue on Crisis Leadership, to find out more about how the Home Team and our partners are managing security risks, dealing with the complexity of decision-making during a crisis and building capability and capacity for crisis leadership. This issue also features Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, Mr Pang Kin Keong, who shares more about his leadership journey including leading the Homefront Crisis Executive Group during the COVID-19 pandemic. Read more here: https://lnkd.in/dik6pgNk #HomeTeamAcademy #TrainingandLearning

Honored to work on this piece with a whole team of colleagues like Halitha Banu which is out in the Home Team Journal where we leveraged machine learning techniques and network analysis to explore and understand online discourse on social issues so that leaders may know and understand the features of such issues in the local context As social issues are becoming more socio-technical in nature, it is important for interdisciplinary work to help make sense of these social issues and to use machine-learning techniques to help sense-make voluminous qualitative data. Title: Anticipating crises arising from intergroup tensions: Decoding identity-related online discourse in multicultural Singapore.

I had the privilege to attend a keynote session with best-selling author Simon Sinek's The Optimism Company during the International Association of Chiefs of Police. I tried to pull together some of the best leadership advice as he spoke directly to police chiefs, sheriffs, strategic comms advisors, and leaders. Here is part 1 of his thought-provoking challenge to the leadership of our noble profession. #IACP2023 #SimonSinek #PoliceLeadership

"...understand that you are leading human beings. You can't lead an organization, you can only run an organization....You can only lead people, and that skillset is unique...Leading people is something profoundly different and most police organizations have sub-adequate training on how to lead human beings; it's not a criticism, it's an opportunity." Thanks to Chief Christopher Cook for capturing Simon Sinek's fireside chat with #IACP2023 attendees where he discusses the opportunities police leaders have to profoundly modernize the industry.
